name: Data-Action Paradox
description: Extensive monitoring infrastructure (29 stations, SIMOLEK, research) exists but knowledge-action linkages remain weak. Data collection continues without evidence-based management action.

name: Authority-Accountability Paradox
description: Authority without legitimacy, coordination responsibility without enforcement power. Provincial agencies coordinate but cannot compel national agencies.

name: Coordination-Fragmentation Paradox
description: Multiple coordination forums (Pokja, TKPSDA, Forum DAS) exist but fragmentation persists. More meetings correlate with less integrated action.

name: Budget-Impact Paradox
description: 156 billion rupiah allocated to military hyacinth removal (symptom treatment) while zero compensation to displaced farmers (root cause unaddressed).

name: Participation-Exclusion Paradox
description: Multi-stakeholder forums exist but critical actors excluded: BPN absent from coordination, communities marginalized in decisions affecting their livelihoods.

name: Scientific-Political Paradox
description: Scientific knowledge produced (Prof. Naning KJA research, hypereutrophic status) but political decisions ignore evidence. Knowledge exists but not integrated into enforcement.

name: Regulation-Violation Paradox
description: Comprehensive regulations exist but violations persist openly. KJA 21Ã— overcapacity despite clear limits, land certification during lake expansion.

name: Planning-Implementation Paradox
description: Elaborate plans (RP Danau 2018-2024, master plans) produced but implementation minimal. 'Rapat tanpa action' (meetings without action).
